function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential for inadequate data collection on covid-19 status and response measures in construction organizations.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 among construction workers","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 rna in wastewater samples indicating potential contamination and spread of covid-19.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of sars-cov-2 presence in water samples","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Re-emerging zoonotic hepatitis e virus detected in the built environment","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of coronavirus through respiratory droplets and possibly via fecal-oral route.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overfitting of the model due to prolonged training","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The use of a facial mask detection system may lead to a false sense of security among the public, potentially reducing adherence to other important preventive measures for covid-19.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on a technology-driven approach without addressing underlying social and behavioral factors may overlook the root causes of non-compliance with mask-wearing rules.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of face mask compliance in public places","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-compliance with social distancing and mask-wearing guidelines accelerating the spread of covid-19.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness about the importance of room ventilation in reducing covid-19 risk","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective remote work infrastructure leading to prolonged indoor isolation","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of private cars due to safety concerns about public transport","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dramatic reduction in demand for public transport","category":"Transport","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of personal risk of infection","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on mobility","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mobility behavior changes due to subjective levels of safety and mental comfort","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Informal housing networks contributing to disease spread","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 bringing new challenges and opportunities for public and social housing sectors","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid housing policy making taking place in many countries due to covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Systematic literature mapping methodological article with relevance for covid-19 housing policy making","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in public reliance on waterhumandata may lead to misinformation and panic during outbreaks or challenging conditions.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standardised method for covid-19 measurements","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of computational models on decision-making, leading to oversight of important real-world aspects","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of confidence in water services","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reliance on sewage tracking for disease severity assessment may overlook unrepresented cases in the community","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Blurred boundaries between water services and public health","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater raises concerns about potential transmission and public health risks through sewage epidemiology.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerable households at risk of water supply cut off, leading to a threat to public health due to the inability to practice regular handwashing","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased revenue from water service leading to potential costly breakdowns and permanent closure of businesses or industries","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in treated effluent for beneficial uses due to reduced consumption","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Blurring of boundaries between conventional engineering and socio-technical management in the water sector","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in chlorine dose in drinking water distribution","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in water consumption patterns","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in water demand and citizen behavior due to pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on urban water cycle","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The search for resilience in response to infectious diseases must also ensure a more sustainable built environment with a positive balance between health and social, economic, and environmental aspects.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Structural leverage and disruptive change are needed to achieve a sustainable built environment that addresses the risks associated with infectious diseases and other environmental challenges.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of scientific advances and knowledge about diseases","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased probability of infectious diseases due to climate change","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of systemic approaches in addressing public health in the built environment","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of the built environment on disease transmission and public health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social inequalities leading to higher vulnerability to infectious diseases","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate support for vulnerable populations in the built environment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sustainable and resilient design in urban areas","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Win-lose relationship between health and the economy due to social confinement","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Correlation between environmental impacts and economic activity","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 risk control measures and environmental impacts","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adverse effects of the covid-19 outbreak on the environment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
